intro: Machaeranthera inops var. atrata, commonly known as the blackflower false goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, dark purple to black flowers, which are clustered in dense, spherical heads. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, with a grayish-green color. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in desert and semi-desert environments.
